resources.string: Toggles are only available for the left and right swipe ribbons.
To Unlock: enable phone or phablet \"UI mode\"
To Unlock: enable phone or phablet \"UI mode\" and set a \"notification background\"
To Unlock: enable \"face down audio mode\"
To Unlock: enable a \"battery bar location\"
To Unlock: set \"signal indicator style\" to display text or dBm
To Unlock: set \"WiFi signal indicator style\" to display text
To Unlock: set \"toggle style\" to tiles
To Unlock: \"enable fast toggle\" and tiles \"toggle style\"
To Unlock: enable a \"favorite contact\" toggle here or in a Ribbon
To Unlock: enable a \"screenshot\" toggle here or in a Ribbon
To Unlock: enable a \"custom\" toggle here or in a Ribbon

No application found to pick the zip file. Please install a file manager.
Please enter a new label. Enter an empty label to revert to stock label.

Checking this allows your device to rotate to the right

Adds a circular meter surrounding the clear recents button
Holding the hardware Back button will kill the activity in the foreground
This will switch to Tablet UI (requires reboot)
Hide some SystemBar items e.g. the Compatibility Mode button
Checking this will enable the Dual Panel (Tablet) UI used by certain apps
Display the 3-dot overflow menu button within apps
The menu overflow button may not be visible until apps are restarted
The menu overflow button may not be hidden until apps are restarted
Display the name of the currently connected Wifi network
When enabled, this option will allow you to change the brightness by sliding your finger across the Statusbar. Note: Will not be active when auto-brightness is on
Choose the style of the NavBar and Statusbar
Phone - NavBar orients to side in landscape
Phablet - NavBar stays on bottom in landscape
Make sure you follow the steps one-by-one and complete each one before proceeding to the next.
1. Change LCD Density to stock value
Tablets and older phones use 160. Most phones use 240. Galaxy Nexus uses 320 by default.
Come back here after the reboot and complete the rest of the steps!
"Market data couldn't be cleared, please clear it yourself!"
Press back when done to return here.
"Couldn't open the market! If you're sure it's installed, open it yourself from the launcher."
5. Change density to whatever you like!
If you ever have compatibility issues with the market, be sure to return here and repeat the process.
"Changing your LCD density can cause unexpected app behavior. If you encounter market app incompatibility please return here and restart the process from step 1."
Whether to show icons or text on your toggles.
Choose how many toggles to show per row
Choose the order in which your toggles are displayed
Short press for Settings, Longpress for Toggles
Short press for Toggles, Longpress for Settings
Reset all toggles and their order
Close shade on all generic toggle actions
Select the side that triggers the fast toggle
Delay to use after longpressing the screenshot toggle

Each click causes the toggle to move to the next action. If your toggle has an empty click action and no custom icon; the long click action\'s icon will be used.\nThis is useful for users who want their click actions to simply cycle through toggle actions without launching anything.
Will launch state one on boot
Useful for aligning task to displayed icon per your specific usage
Toggle sequence from left to right
Notification shade closes on action completion
Launch all generic toggle actions in a floating window
Abbreviated day of the week before the time
Lets you choose from random, color fill or default background for tiles
Allows you to select your own random colors
View or change how the cLock Home and Lock screen widgets will display
Battery icon will show up where the clear all button shows up
Enabling the charging animation may result in a poor user experience. Enable at your own discretion.
Checking this hides the signal bar indicator (updates when signal strength changes)
Use alternate Gingerbread style signal cluster
Menu buttons can be rearranged or hidden here (in case you are using the Big Menu button)
Define how and when you want the menu buttons to appear
Choose the number of navigation buttons
100 is 70\%% of screen width, 5 is 30\%% of screen width. 0 will default to per button width.
Navigation Bar height while in portrait
Navigation Bar height while in landscape
System Bar height while in portrait

You should reboot right now to make sure everything works properly!
Please reboot for height change to be applied properly!
If checked, custom icons will be colorized
Set the color of the glow that is displayed when you click a NavBar button
Swipe to view - Click to choose
Checking this enables arrow keys in the Navigation Bar while typing
Timeout time for Hidden NavBar Window
Timeout time for Hidden SystemBar Window
Press icon to select actions or custom icon
Do you want to reset the Navigation Ring?
Choose number of targets in the Navigation Ring
Drag your finger to targets to assign actions
Press icons to select actions or delete.\nPress menu for more options.
Vibrate on touch of swipe area
Enable the app name text below the icon
You can not use swipe from bottom with NavBar enabled, must use Navbar Auto Hide or manually hide the NavBar.
With NavBar Auto Hide enabled, longpress the activation area to display ribbon.
Set custom actions for Soft Keys
There will be a slight delay in single click to allow time for double click
Click on the LED to change the color
Flash LED while screen is on
"Would you like to change the app: "
".\nPlease turn off your screen to see the LED. Don't hit OK on this popup till you're done viewing the LED color."
Limit each app\'s notification sounds to play once per the set value
Define behavior of volume when headphones are plugged in
Define behavior of volume when A2DP is connected
Define behavior of volume when you flip your phone face-down
Time the screen is off before the flip sensor is disabled
Time required for your phone to be considered face down

When you flip your phone over: it will go in to either Vibrate or Silent Mode depending on what you have chosen. It will take 1.5 seconds (default) to change once flipped over. It will then disable the flipped mode once the screen is turned on and 15 seconds (default) has passed. NOTE: **You will need to turn the screen back on once flipped over to re-enable sound (once the screen timeout time has been reached)**
Flipping your phone face-down will put your phone into Silent Mode while receiving a call.
Halo will appear for incoming tasks and scroll out of sight after a while
Applies for task switching and moving gestures
When opening an app with HALO the underlying app will get paused
HALO will disappear completely when empty
Show message box for incoming notifications
HALO will ping when device is unlocked if new notifications were received
Control Which apps to stay in notifications to be able to access always through Halo
Enable custom colors for HALO instead of the default theme colors
Defines how big HALO is going to be
Halo message box animation for incoming notifications
Use the menu key to unlock the screen
Lockscreen will have ability to rotate via device orientation. This is independent of Auto-rotation in display.
Warning** Some widgets are not intended to be used on the lockscreen, The widget maker and AOKP are not responsible for your choice of lockscreen widgets. Choose responsibly.
Warning** Adding too many widgets can cause lag issues with lockscreen.
Always show battery percentage on the lockscreen
Show player controls while music is playing
Set whether the hints for the left and right widgets are shown when the screen is turned on.
Set whether the lockscreen challenge is minimized when the screen is turned on.
Use a carousel animation when switching between lockscreen widgets.
Allows you to disable camera widget in lockscreen.
Set to show battery level indicator around lock ring.
Longpress volume buttons to skip tracks while screen is off. Volume wake will not work when music is playing.
Use the stock layout when playing music.
Allows you to see your homescreen behind the lock screen including apps.
Set or remove the current lockscreen background
Show Weather Information on Lockscreen. You need to enable ROMControl\'s Weather service to use this
Whether to show graphical or text weather information.
Show upcoming events from your calendar on the lockscreen.
Select the calendars you want to see.
Select the time-range to be displayed.
If enabled, events will be colored like in your calendar.
If enabled, events which already started won\'t show up.
If enabled, the widget will display multiple events by flipping between them.
Choose the animation speed in seconds.
Longpressing the center of the lock ring or navigation ring will turn torch on. Release finger to turn torch off.
Could not save targets! You must have at least one unlock target!
Drag the unlock icon to targets to assign targets
Touch text to get summary of each option
You must have at least one target that unlocks the screen!
Delete all user created lockscreen target and restore to default?
Select or change the desired application or activity and the associated icon
Enables longpress options for lock screen targets
Whether to pull weather information and display it throughout the ROM.
Setting a custom location can save some battery. Otherwise network-location is used to determine your location.

Be sure to follow the examples! Setting an invalid location will stop you from getting weather updates and may cause unexpected behavior.\n\nExamples: New York,NY // New York, NY // 10033 // London, England
Enabling this will display weather temperature in Celsius rather than Fahrenheit and windspeed in km/h rather than mph.

"Obtaining location from network is currently disabled. This breaks the ability to get the current weather in your current location. Please set a custom location or enable obtaining your location from your network."
Unable to retrieve location information for weather update

You can create your custom vibration patterns in 5 simple steps:
 - Tap New/Reset
 - Tap Record
 - Record your pattern by hitting the TAP! button
 - Tap Stop
 - Tap Save, enter a name and hit OK

 You can check what you just recorded by tapping the Play button.
 If you wish to modify an already saved pattern, tap Load, choose a pattern, re-record, and save it again (it will be overwritten, even if you choose another name).
 To delete a pattern, tap Delete, choose your pattern and tap Delete again. You cannot delete the Default vibration.

 You can choose the default vibration for your phone calls in Phone/Settings or in Settings/Sound.
 You can assign custom vibration patterns to your contacts in the People app: after loading a contact tap Menu/Set vibration.
Concede pink unicorns are for little girls
Default behavior with invisible icons when hidden
Use haptic feedback when pressing toggles
Actions will be executed on screen off. On screen on the previous state will be restored.
Network mode will be switched to 2G on screen off
GPS based location service will be disabled on screen off
Mobile data will be disabled on screen off
Blocking wakelocks have the potential to cause instability, crashes or data loss.
